DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of a dietary fiber, resistant starch, on insulin sensitivity. Low insulin sensitivity is a risk factor for some diseases including type 2 diabetes and heart disease. This study will show if consuming resistant starch can help improve insulin sensitivity in overweight and obese people.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Hi-maize Resistant Starch on Insulin Sensitivity
DOC.criteria: Stable body weight No serious health conditions Waist circumference > or = to 89 cm (females) and 102 cm (males) Diabetes other serious illnesses use of medications that affect outcomes BMI > or = 35.0 kg/m2
